incidents.name: Branching unavailable

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The branching service is unavailable due to an upstream issue with fly.io (https://status.flyio.net/incidents/7lfnb87h43hf) impacting internal service connectivity and workload provisioning.
Branching service was unavailable due to an upstream issue with fly.io (https://status.flyio.net/). The upstream issue has now been resolved and branching should be available once again.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Compute capacity issues observed in the eu-west-3b availability zone

incident_updates.body:
We have identified an issue with our cloud provider regarding insufficient compute capacity in the eu-west-3b availability zone.
We have disabled the ability to restart projects, compute or database version upgrades within eu-west-3b.

Project provisioning in eu-west-3, as well as all operations for projects located in the eu-west-3a and eu-west-3c availability zones are available.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Compute capacity issues observed in the eu-west-3b availability zone

incidents.name: Compute capacity issues encountered in eu-west-3

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have observed an increase in compute capacity for eu-west-3b.
Project restarts, compute upgrades, and database version upgrades have been re-enabled.

We are monitoring available capacity.

We have isolated the issue to the eu-west-3b availability zone. The ability to restart projects, compute or database version upgrades within eu-west-3b is disabled at this time.

Project creation and unpausing has been re-enabled for eu-west-3, as well as restart and upgrade operations for projects located in the eu-west-3a and eu-west-3c availability zones.

We are monitoring compute capacity availability for the eu-west-3b availability zone.

We have identified an issue related to our cloud provider displaying insufficient compute capacity in the eu-west-3 region.
We have disabled the ability to create new projects, restart projects or make compute upgrades in the eu-west-3 region until the observed capacity issues are resolved.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Compute capacity issues observed in eu-west-3

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have observed no further errors and have re-enabled project creation, restarting, and compute upgrade changes again. We will continue to monitor for continued stability.

We are observing a recovery in capacity in the eu-west-3 region and are continuing to monitor the situation.

The ability to create new projects, restart projects or make compute upgrades in the eu-west-3 region are still disabled until the capacity issues are fully resolved.

There is still insufficient compute available in the eu-west-3 region, we have disabled the ability to create new projects, restart projects or make compute upgrades in the eu-west-3 region until the capacity issues are resolved. 

We are working with AWS to come up with a timeframe for when this capacity issue may be resolved.

There is still insufficient compute available in the eu-west-3 region, we have disabled the ability to create new projects, restart projects or make compute upgrades in the eu-west-3 region until the capacity issues are resolved.
We recommend that customers with projects in the eu-west-3 region should not perform restarts or compute upgrades until the capacity issues are resolved.
We have identified the issue as being related to our cloud provider displaying insufficient compute capacity in the eu-west-3 region.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Realtime Connectivity Issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
Realtime has stabilized across all projects, both old and new. We are now monitoring to ensure that things remain up and stable.

The issues has been identified, and previously existing projects should now be stable. Newly created projects will still be seeing some connectivity issues, and we're working on the final changes to get those working as well.
The team is continuing to investigate, and we are getting closer to understanding the root cause.
The team is continuing to investigate. We have seen improvements for regions outside of the European regions, which are still experiencing elevated errors.
Our engineers continue to investigate the root cause of the issue, we are adding new capacity and taking steps to stabilize the service.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Increase in users hitting Auth Rate Limits

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Auth projects with email address or phone confirmations disabled had no email rate limits applied before 2024-10-21. This may be surprising to some projects whose rate limit configuration has not been kept up-to-date. Fix to previous behavior is rolling out.

Investigating increased email and SMS send rate limit errors across all projects in Supabase Auth. Proactively check your rate limit configuration and increase them if necessary, especially if you had disabled email or SMS confirmation. You can check your rate limit settings in the dashboard here: https://supabase.com/dashboard/project/_/auth/rate-limits
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have seen no further connectivity issues with Supavisor for the last 90 or so minutes, and approximately 1 hour for realtime, but we are continuing to monitor.

We observed an issue with both realtime service's ability to connect and also supavisor connectivity issues.

 Things are looking stable now, but we're keeping an eye out for any further trouble.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: New Users unable to create organizations preventing sign up

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have released a fix for this, and things are looking stable. If you were having trouble before, a refresh should resolve it for you now.

If you are still having trouble, please reach out to us via https://supabase.help or by emailing support@supabase.io and please reference this incident as well as describe the issues you are still having.

Current users are unaffected, and all projects remain available. This is limited to new user signups, so if you are trying to sign up for Supabase, please bear with us and please try again once this incident is resolved.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Auth limits due to default SMTP server usage unintentionally enforced on Token, Verify, and Admin endpoints

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The rollout is complete and we are monitoring.
The fix is being rolled out to all affected instances, we are 50% complete, we estimate that it will be 1h 30 minutes until the rollout is complete.
We have identified the issue and a fix is being deployed.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Edge functions currently disabled for us-east-1 region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We believe the network connectivity issues we were seeing in us-east-1 have been resolved, and the region has been re-enabled.

You may now specify it, and it will also participate in requests without a region specified again.

We'll monitor for any additional errors, but things are looking good now.

We have temporarily disabled edge functions in us-east-1. Requests without a region should reroute to another region automatically; however, if you specify us-east-1 for any of your functions, please choose another region at this time.

We've added capacity to other regions, and global error rates have returned to normal levels.

We are working with AWS on a resolution and hope to re-enable us-east-1 soon.

We will provide additional updates as we have them.

We have identified network connectivity issues at our hosting provider (AWS) in us-east-1, which is preventing requests from reaching edge functions. We are looking into solutions.

Increased pressure in other regions due to requests being rerouted around us-east-1 are resulting in higher than normal error rates, for which we are currently increasing resources to accommodate the additional traffic.
We are currently investigating this issue.

components.name: Edge Functions

incidents.name: Read Replica Load Balancers incorrectly attempting to route to deleted replicas

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been rolled out, and the configuration for affected projects has been fixed as well.

It was also determined that the bug was introduced at ~0755 on the 24th of September, and three projects in total were impacted by the edge condition that was determined to be buggy.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Projects using the default email provider experiencing errors sending emails

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The fix has been applied to all existing projects as well. At this time, things are looking back to normal, but we will continue monitoring for further issues.

The change for the default email provider is still rolling out to existing projects, and is about 60% done. We'll continue to update here as things progress.

We still suggest using your own SMTP provider for production workloads. For instructions on setting up your own SMTP provider, see here: https://supabase.com/docs/guides/auth/auth-smtp

The change for the default email provider is still rolling out to existing projects, and is about 32% done. We'll continue to update here as things progress.

We still suggest using your own SMTP provider for production workloads. For instructions on setting up your own SMTP provider, see here: https://supabase.com/docs/guides/auth/auth-smtp

The change for the default email provider is still rolling out to existing projects, and is about 15% done. We'll continue to update here as things progress.

We still suggest using your own SMTP provider for production workloads. For instructions on setting up your own SMTP provider, see here: https://supabase.com/docs/guides/auth/auth-smtp

We've made the swap to our new upstream provider for all newly created projects. We're working pushing the change out to all existing projects.

However, we still suggest using your own SMTP provider for production workloads. For instructions on setting up your own SMTP provider, see here: https://supabase.com/docs/guides/auth/auth-smtp

We have identified an issue with our upstream email provider, and are working to move this to a different service.

In the meantime, we would always suggest using your own SMTP provider for production workloads. For instructions on setting up your own SMTP provider, see here: https://supabase.com/docs/guides/auth/auth-smtp
We are currently investigating this issue.

We are continuing to investigate this issue.

incidents.name: Intermittent errors connecting to some Fly regions from eu-central-1 region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Fly has found and fixed a misconfiguration in their edge network, and all connectivity from eu-central-1 to fly regions now appears to be working again. 

We are monitoring for further issues, but things are looking good now.

We've worked with Resend on a workaround for the more general connectivity issues from AWS eu-central-1 to Fly, and at this time email actions should now be working again.

If you have other things that communicate between your Supabase service and Fly regions, you may still see some errors.

We are continuing to work with Fly and AWS to resolve the broader issue.
We believe we have isolated these connectivity problems to a routing issue outside of Supabase networks, somewhere between AWS and Fly. We are working with both teams to resolve this issue.

While working with Resend on this issue, we discovered that there are periodic connectivity issues between our eu-central-1 and some Fly regions. We are investigating the cause of that now.

Users in eu-central-1 may continue to see periodic failures with email actions until this is resolved.

Some customers in eu-central-1 are reporting intermittent errors sending emails due to periodic issues connecting to Resend. The Resend team is aware and is working towards a resolution. You can follow their status page here: https://resend-status.com/incident/428717

incidents.name: Project Upgrades are temporarily disabled

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Upgrades have been re-enabled, and affected projects have been fixed.

We have identified the issue. For safety, we are leaving upgrades for existing projects disabled. There are a very small number of projects which may be seeing connectivity issues for Storage, and connections via Supavisor, and will be prioritized for a fix as soon as one is available.

Once those projects have been fixed, and the fix more broadly applied, upgrades will be re-enabled. We will update this page as we have additional information.
We're investigating reports that the Pooler service (and Storage, which uses Pooler) is non-functional for a small number of projects after upgrading to the latest release.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Some newly created or unpaused projects are seeing DNS propagation failures

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've determined that about 50 project upgrades were also affected by this issue, and the DNS records for these projects have been fixed as well.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We're working with our DNS provider to resolve this issue, which is affecting about 50 projects created over the last 12 hours.
Affected projects would see failures in resolving their project's hostname, with errors such as "nxdomain", or "couldn't resolve hostname".
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Project creation in West EU (Paris) and East US (Ohio) is temporarily disabled

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Project provisioning and infrastructure operations impacted in us-east-1

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Service to us-east-1 has been restored. We're monitoring the situation.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Supabase Support Backend Outage - Delayed Support Response

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

It looks like service has been restored, and the form in the dashboard should be working as expected now. We'll leave this open a while longer and monitor for any more issues, until our provider has set their own incident as resolved.

We appreciate your patience as we get back to responding to your support requests.

Our support system provider is currently experiencing a global outage, which has resulted in Supabase Support being unable to timely see and respond to your tickets and requests.

This has also resulted in the Support form via our dashboard having limited functionality. For the moment, if you have a support request, please email support@supabase.com and in the body of your message, please make sure you include the project ID(s) and Org ID(s), and as much detail about the nature of your problem as you can, and we will get to these as soon as possible.

incidents.name: Read Replica creation is temporarily disabled

incident_updates.body: The fix has now been rolled out to all impacted read replicas.

We have implemented a fix and replica creation has now been re-enabled.
We are in process of rolling out the fix to the impacted read replicas.

A fix is currently being implemented.
We recommend not destroying any existing read replicas as creation of new ones is currently disabled.

Read replicas created after 2024-08-03 have had their Postgrest service (HTTP Data APIs) set up incorrectly; a fix will be backported to the affected instances.

Other services, including the Postgres database, are not affected.

We recommend not destroying any existing read replicas as creation of new ones remains disabled.
We've temporarily disabled replica creation while we investigate an issue with Data APIs (Postgrest) on replicas
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Postgres Version Upgrades are temporarily disabled

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Postgres version upgrades have been re-enabled.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Postgres Version Upgrades are temporarily disabled for Projects using Wrappers

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
All projects are now allowed to use the Postgres Version Upgrades functionality.

Projects not using Wrappers can now use the Postgres upgrade functionality.

Upgrades remain disabled for projects that are using older Wrappers versions (< 0.4.1); a fix will be released for this later today.

If you have the Wrappers extension installed but would like to upgrade before a fix is released, you can:
- drop the extension, if you have it installed but are not using it. This will unblock upgrades.
- drop the extension, execute the upgrade, and thereafter create the extension again. Note that this will drop any FDWs managed by Wrappers.

Existing projects continue to be unaffected and are serving traffic normally. Project creation is not affected.

Project upgrades are temporarily disabled, while we investigate an issue that affects projects that are using an older release of Wrappers, and go through an upgrade.

Existing projects are unaffected and continue to serve traffic normally. Project creation is not affected.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Error rates in all the 3 regions are back to normal and we are monitoring the situation
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Some users are experiencing issues with email + password logins to the Supabase Dashboard

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have determined the users receiving this error message were github signups, who were attempting to sign in with a username/password. We are rolling out an update to provide the expected wrong username/password error. 

But at this time, we have no reason to suspect that the login flow is working incorrectly for any users.

If you receive an unexpected error, please try logging in with github. If that fails, please contact our support at support@supbase.com

We have identified an issue logging in to the Supabase Dashboard from some users who sign in with Github.

A small number of users who normally sign in via Github may see an unexpected server error rather if they attempt to login with an email and password instead.

Users who experience this error should attempt to sign in with Github to resolve the issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.

components.name: Dashboard
components.description: The studio, docs and primary website at https://supabase.com

incidents.name: Data and Auth API Connectivity issues in SA-East-1

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The ISP has fixed the issue and we are monitoring the situation.
The problem has been narrowed down to an ISP having degraded performance with IPv6 traffic. Our CDN provider is working with the ISP to resolve the issue.

We're continuing to work with Cloudflare and AWS on identifying the source of the interruption between the two.

Affected connections are to projects hosted in the AWS sa-east-1 region, generally when contacted from us-east-1 (but potentially others as well).

Workarounds include:

- relocating client workloads to us-west-1 
- temporarily using an IPv4 add-on (the interruption only seems to be affecting IPv6 traffic)

The connectivity issue seems to be affecting connections made from the AWS us-east-1 region (including, e.g. Vercel resources hosted in iad1), to projects hosted in the AWS sa-east-1 region.

Initiating requests from other AWS regions should work without issues, and can be used as a workaround (e.g. by moving client service/app hosting locations).

We're still working on a root cause and resolution.

There seem to be Cloudflare connectivity issues between some regions in North and South America, to our projects hosted in the sa-east-1 region.

Other regions seem to be unaffected.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.

EU-Central-1 has completed. Only AP-* regions still in progress.
The fix has rolled out to all US / SA regions, and most EU regions. EU-Central-1 and all AP-* regions are still in progress.
Mitigations are still being rolled out across the fleet. We will update again once these are complete.
We have also discovered that a small number of projects may see user login failures, for new user signups after ~0900 UTC. We are currently working on remediation steps to get these resolved as well.

We have identified an additional issue with new user signups to the Supabase Platform related to this incident.

New accounts created from ~11:45 UTC today may have issues logging into their Supabase account or changing their password.

We are working on a resolution to this, and will reach out to all affected signups directly
All affected customers have been rolled back and the release rollout has been paused.

incidents.name: Some New User Signups are not allowing new users to sign in

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have taken steps to restore the errant signups, and all users should be able to login now as expected.

All users should also now be able to do password resets as expected.

If you are still experiencing issues, please contact support at support@supabase.com

We're still testing the least impactful method to get the new signups between 0900-14:30 UTC today back to a functional state. All signups outside of that period (both before and after) are unaffected.

If you signed up during those times, please hang tight. We'll be in touch with you all directly once we have the best path forward.

New Signups during this period will need additional action to remediate. We are working on resolution, and will reach out to all affected signups directly.

Additionally, we discovered that password reset attempts were also interrupted during this event. If you tried to reset your password before and did not get an email, please try again now. If you are still having trouble, please reach out to Supabase Support.

A fix has been deployed, and new user sign-ups from this point forward should function as per normal. Existing users continue to be unaffected.

We're currently investigating if further action is needed for users that signed up during the 0900-1430Z interval.
Existing users, who had signed up prior to ~0900Z 4th July are not affected.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incident_updates.body: We've resolve the underlying issue, and also corrected the routing configuration for the projects that were impacted.

Only Projects with Read Replicas that have made subscription or add-on changes in the last week are affected. For these affected projects, some HTTP requests (e.g. Auth) are getting incorrectly redirected to the Replicas, rather than the Primary.

incidents.name: Logs collection disrupted for a small number of projects

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Most projects in EU and APAC regions have been addressed.

If you're still seeing issues, or require more urgent assistance because of the disruption, please open a ticket at https://supabase.help
We're still in the process of rolling out an updated config.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We're rolling out a config update for the logs collection process, in order to eliminate the issue from impacted projects.

Other than the logs collection, no other functionality is impacted. New projects are not impacted, and the vast majority of existing projects are not impacted.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Issues with provisioning projects using Fly.io as a cloud provider

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Cloud provider has confirmed a fix has been deployed. 
We are monitoring project provisioning on our end.

Fly Postgres and branch projects are currently impacted.

Cloud provider incident status: https://status.flyio.net/incidents/nrn01yzm486m
We are currently investigating this issue.
